title.narrative: OUTPUT 4.2 CHILD-SENSITIVE AND INCLUSIVE

description.narrative: Output 4.2: Child-sensitive and inclusive social protectionBy 2020, strengthened capacity to develop a child-sensitive and inclusive social protection policy framework and action plan to provide a comprehensive vision and commitment to the progressive realization of universal coverage of social protection., which contributes to Adolescent Empowerment, Adolescent Health And Nutrition, Child Health, Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Child Protection â€“ General, Economic And Social Policy General, Education â€“ General, Health â€“ General, Hiv Prevention, Hiv â€“ General, Immunization, Nutrition â€“ General, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition, Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence, Social Protection, Social Protection And Child Poverty, Treatment And Care Of Children Living With Hiv, Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition, Wash â€“ General. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 4. By 2020, improved equity-sensitive and child-friendly policies, programmes and budget allocations based on high-quality evidence and strengthened oversight

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 4.2: Child-sensitive and inclusive social protectionBy 2020, strengthened capacity to develop a child-sensitive andinclusive social protection policy framework and action plan to provide a comprehensive vision and commitment to the progressiverealization of universal coverage of social protection.

description.narrative: UNICEF remained a leader in social protection in 2020, supporting the government, development partners and civil society in ensuring the continuity of social protection programming and data-driven decision-making during the COVID-19 pandemic. In addition, UNICEF actively contributed to the finalization of the NDP III and UNSDCF documents, ensuring integration of social protection actions, and worked to strengthen the humanitarian-development nexus, including through shock-responsive, child-sensitive, and gender-responsive social protection approaches. Finally, UNICEF supported social protection programming and evidence generation through the KCCA-GEG programme, EU Joint Action on PFM for social protection, and the UNJP social protection programme in West Nile. | Status:Met | As-of Date:13/01/2021

title.narrative: Coordination: Coordination mechanisms for social protection systems established countrywide

baseline.value: Score 1: System is fragmented with no functioning formal social protection coordination mechanisms at local level

target.value: 2020:Level 2 - Social protection coordination mechanism is established and functioning at central and local level
